00019 package WeBWorK::NPL;
00020 use base 'Exporter';
00021 
00022 =head1 NAME
00023 
00024 WeBWorK::NPL - Parse formats used by the National Problem Library.
00025 
00026 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00027 
00028     use WeBWorK::NPL qw/read_textbooks read_tags format_tags gen_find_tags/;
00029     
00030     open TEXTS, "<", "Textbooks";
00031     my $textbooks = [];
00032     read_textbooks(\*TEXTS, $textbooks);
00033     
00034     open PGFILE, "<", "file.pg";
00035     my $tags = {};
00036     read_tags(\*PGFILE, $tags);
00037     
00038     foreach my $string (format_tags($tags)) {
00039         $string =~ s/^/## /gm;
00040         print "TAG: $string\n";
00041     }
00042     
00043     use File::Find;
00044     my $process = sub { print "Found: $_[0]\n" };
00045     my $wanted = gen_find_tags({author=>'Rogawski'}, $process);
00046     find({wanted=>$wanted}, @ARGV);
00047 
00048 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00049 
00050 This package contains parsing routines for the various data formats associated
00051 with the National Problem Library.
00052 
00053 =cut
00054 
00055 use strict;
00056 use warnings;
00057 use Data::Dumper;
00058 
00059 our @EXPORT_OK = qw(
00060     read_textbooks
00061     read_tags
00062     format_tags
00063     gen_find_tags
00064 );
00065 
00066 our @global_fields = qw(DESCRIPTION KEYWORDS DBsubject DBchapter DBsection Date
00067 Institution Author UsesAuxiliaryFiles);
00068 our @textbook_fields = qw(title edition author chapter section problem);
00069 
00070 our %tag2field = ( TitleText => "title", EditionText => "edition",
00071 AuthorText => "author", Section => "section", Problem => "problem", );
00072 our %field2tag = reverse %tag2field;
00073 
00074 =head1 FUNCTIONS
00075 
00076 =head2 read_textbooks
00077 
00078     read_textbooks($fh, $arrayref)
00079 
00080 Reads a Textbooks file opened for reading on $fh and appends its contents to
00081 $arrayref. Each item appended to $arrayref is a reference to a hash containing
00082 the following keys:
00083 
00084     _title      The title of the textbook
00085     _edition    The edition of the textbook
00086     _author     The author of the textbook
00087     1           The name of chapter 1
00088     1.1         The name of section 1.1
00089     1.2         The name of section 1.2
00090     ...
00091     2           The name of chapter 2
00092     2.1         The name of section 2.1
00093     ...
00094 
00095 Since the number of sections in a textbook is typically small, it is not terribly
00096 inefficient to pull chapters or sections out:
00097 
00098     @chapters = grep { /^\d+$/ } keys %textbook;
00099     @sections = grep { /^\d+\.\d+$/ } keys %textbook;
00100 
00101 =cut
00102 
00103 sub read_textbooks {
00104     my ($fh, $result) = @_;
00105     
00106     my %curr_textbook;
00107     
00108     while (<$fh>) {
00109         s/#.*$//g;
00110         next unless /\S/;
00111         s/^\s*//;
00112         s/\s*$//;
00113         
00114         if (/^(TitleText|EditionText|AuthorText)\(\s*'(.*?)'\s*\)/) {
00115             my $field = $tag2field{$1};
00116             my $value = $2;
00117             if (exists $curr_textbook{"_$field"}) {
00118                 # repeated tag -- this is a new textbook
00119                 push @$result, {%curr_textbook};
00120                 %curr_textbook = ();
00121             }
00122             $curr_textbook{"_$field"} = $value;
00123         } elsif (/^(\d+)(?:\.(\d+))?\s*>>>\s*(.*)$/) {
00124             my $chapter = $1;
00125             my $section = $2;
00126             my $name = $3;
00127             if (defined $section and length $section > 0) {
00128                 $curr_textbook{"$chapter.$section"} = $name;
00129             } else {
00130                 $curr_textbook{$chapter} = $name;
00131             }
00132         }
00133     }
00134     push @$result, {%curr_textbook};
00135 }
00136 
00137 =head2 read_tags
00138 
00139     read_tags($fh, $hashref, $extra_editing_info);
00140 
00141 Reads the NPL tags from a PG file opened for reading on $fh and stores the tags
00142 in %$hashref. The following keys may be added to %$hashref:
00143 
00144     DESCRIPTION
00145     KEYWORDS
00146     DBsubject
00147     DBchapter
00148     DBsection
00149     Date
00150     Institution
00151     Author
00152     UsesAuxiliaryFiles      (experimental, subject to change)
00153     textbooks               (arrayref)
00154 
00155 The value for the C<textbooks> key will be a reference to an array of textbook
00156 hashes containing the textbook tags from the source file. In each textbook hash,
00157 entries with empty values (e.g. C<TitleText1('')>) will be omitted. This is to
00158 deal with the large number of empty-valued tags in the NPL. The keys of each
00159 textbook hash will be among:
00160 
00161     title
00162     edition
00163     author
00164     chapter
00165     section
00166     problem        (arrayref)
00167 
00168 The value for the C<problem> key will be a reference to an array of problem
00169 numbers.
00170 
00171 If $extra_editing_info is true, special hash items _pos, _rest, and _maxtextbook
00172 will also be added to %$hashref.
00173 
00174 _pos will contain the position of the first byte of the next line after the last
00175 tag in the file. _rest will contain the bytes of the "rest" of the file, after
00176 all tags, starting at _pos. _maxtextbook will contain the highest number used to
00177 identify a textbook in the file. (e.g. If TitleText1 and TitleText3 appear in
00178 the  file, there will only be two items in the textbooks array, but _maxtextbook
00179 will be 3.)
00180 
00181 This is useful for appending tags to a file which contains existing tags, where
00182 the new tags should appear immediately after the existing tags:
00183 
00184     open PGFILE, "+<", "file.pg";
00185     my $tags = {};
00186     read_tags(\*PGFILE, $tags, 1);
00187     my $pos = $tags{_pos};
00188     my $rest = $tags{_rest};
00189     seek PGFILE, $pos, 0;
00190     print PGFILE "## SomeNewTag('foo','bar')\n";
00191     print PGFILE $rest;
00192     close PGFILE;
00193 
00194 =cut
00195 
00196 sub read_tags {
00197     my ($file, $result, $extra_editing_info) = @_;
00198     
00199     my $fh;
00200     if (ref $file) {
00201         $fh = $file;
00202     } elsif (defined $file and not ref $file) {
00203         $fh = new IO::File($file, 'r');
00204     }
00205     
00206     my $pos;
00207     my $rest = '';
00208     my $maxtextbook;
00209     while (<$fh>) {
00210         #if (0) {
00211         if (/^(.*?\#.*?)(\s*)DESCRIPTION/) {
00212             my $prefix = $1;
00213             my $whitespace = $2;
00214             my $description = '';
00215             while (<$fh>) {
00216                 if (/\#.*ENDDESCRIPTION/) {
00217                     chomp $description;
00218                     $result->{DESCRIPTION} = $description if length $description > 0;
00219                     last;
00220                 } else {
00221                     # handle prefix and whitespace separately so that we can still
00222                     # chop the prefix off even if people are being careless about
00223                     # whitespace. :P
00224                     s/^$prefix//;
00225                     s/^$whitespace//;
00226                     $description .= $_;
00227                 }
00228             }
00229             if ($extra_editing_info) {
00230                 $pos = tell $fh;
00231                 $rest = '';
00232             }
00233         } elsif (/\#.*KEYWORDS\((.*)\)/) {
00234             my $keywords = $1;
00235             push @{$result->{KEYWORDS}}, parse_keywords($keywords);
00236             if ($extra_editing_info) {
00237                 $pos = tell $fh;
00238                 $rest = '';
00239             }
00240         } elsif (/\#.*(DBsubject|DBchapter|DBsection|Date|Institution|Author)\(\s*(.*?)\s*\)/) {
00241             my $field = $1;
00242             my $value = $2;
00243             my ($parsed_value, $parse_errors) = parse_normal_value($field, $value);
00244             if (@$parse_errors) {
00245                 warn "error while parsing value \"$value\" in field $field:\n"
00246                     . join('', @$parse_errors)
00247                     . "value may be incomplete. use with caution.\n"
00248                     . "(line $. of file $file)\n";
00249             }
00250             $result->{$field} = $parsed_value;
00251             if ($extra_editing_info) {
00252                 $pos = tell $fh;
00253                 $rest = '';
00254             }
00255         } elsif (/\#.*(TitleText|EditionText|AuthorText|Section|Problem)(\d+)\(\s*'(.*?)'\s*\)/) {
00256             my $field = $tag2field{$1};
00257             my $num = $2;
00258             my $value = $3;
00259             next unless $value =~ /\S/;
00260             $value = [ parse_problems($value) ] if $field eq "problem";
00261             if ($field eq "section") {
00262                 my ($ch, $sec) = split /\./, $value;
00263                 $result->{textbooks}[$num]{chapter} = $ch;
00264                 $result->{textbooks}[$num]{section} = $sec if defined $sec and length $sec > 0;
00265             } else {
00266                 $result->{textbooks}[$num]{$field} = $value;
00267             }
00268             if ($extra_editing_info) {
00269                 $pos = tell $fh;
00270                 $rest = '';
00271                 $maxtextbook = $num if not defined $maxtextbook or $num > $maxtextbook;
00272             }
00273         } elsif (/\#.*(UsesAuxiliaryFiles)\(\s*(.*?)\s*\)/) {
00274             my $field = $1;
00275             my $value = $2;
00276             my ($parsed_value, $parse_errors) = parse_normal_list($field, $value);
00277             if (@$parse_errors) {
00278                 warn "error while parsing list value \"$value\" in field $field:\n"
00279                     . join('', @$parse_errors)
00280                     . "value may be incomplete. use with caution.\n"
00281                     . "(line $. of file $file)\n";
00282             }
00283             $result->{$field} = $parsed_value;
00284             if ($extra_editing_info) {
00285                 $pos = tell $fh;
00286                 $rest = '';
00287             }
00288         } else {
00289             if ($extra_editing_info) {
00290                 $rest .= $_;
00291             }
00292         }
00293     }
00294     
00295     # remove holes in textbook numbering
00296     @{$result->{textbooks}} = grep { defined } @{$result->{textbooks}};
00297     delete $result->{textbooks} unless @{$result->{textbooks}};
00298     
00299     if ($extra_editing_info) {
00300         $result->{_pos} = $pos;
00301         $result->{_rest} = $rest;
00302         $result->{_maxtextbook} = $maxtextbook;
00303     }
00304 }
00305 
00306 sub parse_normal_list {
00307     my ($name, $string) = @_;
00308     
00309     use constant NRM=>0;
00310     use constant STR=>1;
00311     use constant ESC=>2;
00312     use constant STP=>3;
00313     my $state = NRM;
00314     my @errors;
00315     my @items;
00316     my $curr_item = '';
00317     my $next_item = 0;
00318     foreach my $i (0 .. length($string)-1) {
00319         my $c = substr($string,$i,1);
00320         #print "i=$i c=$c state=$state curr_item=$curr_item next_item=$next_item\n";
00321         # state changes
00322         if ($state == NRM) {
00323             if ($c eq "'") {
00324                 $state = STR;
00325             } elsif ($c eq ',' or $c eq ' ') {
00326                 # do nothing -- closequote already consumed curr_item
00327             } else {
00328                 push @errors, 
00329                     "illegal char '$c' in state NRM while parsing value for $name.\n"
00330                     . "    $string\n"
00331                     . '    ' . ' 'x$i . "^\n";
00332                 $next_item = 1;
00333                 $state = STP;
00334             }
00335         } elsif ($state == STR) {
00336             if ($c eq "'") {
00337                 $state = NRM;
00338                 $next_item = 1;
00339             } elsif ($c eq '\\') {
00340                 $state = ESC;
00341             } else {
00342                 $curr_item .= $c;
00343             }
00344         } elsif ($state == ESC) {
00345             $curr_item .= $c;
00346             $state = STR;
00347         } elsif ($state == STP) {
00348             last;
00349         } else {
00350             die "unexpected state $state while parsing value for $name.\n";
00351         }
00352         #print "i=$i c=$c state=$state curr_item=$curr_item next_item=$next_item\n";
00353         # actions
00354         if ($next_item) {
00355             push @items, $curr_item;
00356             $curr_item = '';
00357             $next_item = 0;
00358             #print "stored item to list\n";
00359         }
00360     }
00361     
00362     return \@items, \@errors;
00363 }
00364 
00365 sub parse_normal_value {
00366     my ($name, $string) = @_;
00367     my ($items, $errors) = parse_normal_list($name, $string);
00368     push @$errors, "only one item allowed in value for $name.\n" if @$items > 1;
00369     return shift @$items, $errors;
00370 }
00371 
00372 # this now works for keywords is embedded spaces (which are later stripped out
00373 # by kwtidy) but now it doesn't work for values with double quotes or no quotes!
00374 sub parse_keywords {
00375     my $string = shift;
00376     my ($items, $errors) = parse_normal_list('KEYWORDS', $string);
00377     if (@$errors) {
00378         warn "errors while parsing KEYWORDS list:\n@$errors\n"
00379             . "Partially-parsed KEYWORDS: @$items\n"
00380             . "Resorting to old-style KEYWORDS parsing...\n";
00381         @$items = split /(?:,|\s)+/, $string;
00382         warn "Old-style parse result: ", join('|', @$items), "\n";
00383     }
00384     return map { kwtidy($_) } @$items;
00385 }
00386 
00387 sub kwtidy {
00388     my $keyword = shift;
00389     $keyword =~ s/\W//g;
00390     $keyword =~ s/_//g;
00391     return lc $keyword;
00392 }
00393 
00394 sub parse_problems {
00395     my $string = shift;
00396     $string =~ s/\D/ /g;
00397     return grep { /\S/ } split /\s+/, $string;
00398 }
00399 
00400 =head2 format_tags
00401 
00402     format_tags($tags, $mintextbook);
00403 
00404 Given a reference to a hash of tags, return a list of strings representing said
00405 tags. The strings do not begin with the standard NPL comment prefix ("## ") or
00406 end with newlines. These must be added by the caller if the strings are to be
00407 inserted into a PG source file.
00408 
00409 One complication is the DESCRIPTION field, which contains embedded newlines. If
00410 a DESCRIPTION tag occurs in %$tags, it will be formatted with embedded newlines
00411 but without a trailing newline. For example, after this code executes,
00412 
00413     $tags = { DESCRIPTION => "line one\nline two\nline three" };
00414     ($desc) = format_tags($tags);
00415 
00416 $desc will contain the string:
00417 
00418     "DESCRIPTION\nline one\nline two\nline three\nENDDESCRIPTION"
00419 
00420 To account for this when writing to a PG file, you could use:
00421 
00422     foreach my $string (format_tags($tags)) {
00423         $string =~ s/^/## /gm;
00424         print PGFILE "$string\n";
00425     }
00426 
00427 =cut
00428 
00429 sub format_tags {
00430     my ($tags, $mintextbook) = @_;
00431     $mintextbook ||= 1;
00432     my @result;
00433     my @ordered_fields = grep { exists $tags->{$_} } @global_fields, "textbooks";
00434     foreach my $field (@ordered_fields) {
00435         my $value = $tags->{$field};
00436         if ($field eq "DESCRIPTION") {
00437             push @result, format_description($value);
00438         } elsif ($field eq "textbooks") {
00439             push @result, format_textbooks($value, $mintextbook);
00440         } else {
00441             push @result, format_tag($field, $value);
00442         }
00443     }
00444     return @result;
00445 }
00446 
00447 sub format_tag {
00448     my ($field, $value, $n) = @_;
00449     my $tag = $field2tag{$field} || $field;
00450     
00451     # problems are always listed in a single string in the tag.
00452     if ($field eq "problem") {
00453         $value = format_problems($value);
00454     }
00455     
00456     # if we have an arrayref, we represent it as multiple strings in one tag.
00457     if (ref $value) {
00458         $value = join(',', map { "'$_'" } @$value);
00459     } elsif (defined $value) {
00460         $value = "'$value'";
00461     } else {
00462         warn "value is not defined for field $field!\n";
00463         $value = "''";
00464     }
00465     
00466     if (defined $n) {
00467         return "$tag$n($value)";
00468     } else {
00469         return "$tag($value)";
00470     }
00471 }
00472 
00473 sub format_description {
00474     my $value = shift;
00475     return "DESCRIPTION\n$value\nENDDESCRIPTION";
00476 }
00477 
00478 sub format_textbooks {
00479     my ($textbook, $n) = @_;
00480     my @textbooks = @$textbook;
00481     my @result;
00482     foreach my $textbook (@textbooks) {
00483         push @result, format_textbook($textbook, $n);
00484         $n++;
00485     }
00486     return @result;
00487 }
00488 
00489 sub format_textbook {
00490     my ($textbook, $n) = @_;
00491     
00492     # combine chapter/section into single section tag
00493     my $chapter = $textbook->{chapter};
00494     my $section = $textbook->{section};
00495     if (defined $chapter or defined $section) {
00496         $section = ".$section" if defined $section;
00497         $section = "$chapter$section" if defined $chapter;
00498         delete $textbook->{chapter};
00499         $textbook->{section} = $section;
00500     }
00501     
00502     my @result;
00503     my @ordered_fields = grep { exists $textbook->{$_} } @textbook_fields;
00504     foreach my $field (@ordered_fields) {
00505         my $value = $textbook->{$field};
00506         push @result, format_tag($field, $value, $n);
00507     }
00508     return @result;
00509 }
00510 
00511 sub format_problems {
00512     my $first = shift;
00513     my @problems;
00514     if (ref $first) {
00515         @problems = @$first;
00516     } else {
00517         @problems = ($first, @_);
00518     }
00519     
00520     return join(',', @problems);
00521 }
00522 
00523 =head2 gen_find_tags
00524 
00525     gen_find_tags($pattern, $action, $extra_editing_info);
00526 
00527 Generates an anonymous subroutine suitable for passing the the find() function
00528 of the File::Find module. The no_chdir=>1 option must be passed to find() for
00529 the generated subroutine to operate properly.
00530 
00531 $pattern is a reference to a hash describing the fields that must match. $action
00532 is a reference to a subroutine that will be called if all fields match. 
00533 $extra_editing_info is passed to read_tags().
00534 
00535 Legal fields for $pattern are as follows:
00536 
00537 B<Global fields:> DESCRIPTION, KEYWORDS, DBsubject, DBchapter, DBsection, Date,
00538 Institution, Author. (The experimental UsesAuxiliaryFiles field may be supported
00539 in the future.)
00540 
00541 B<Text-specific fields:> title, edition, author, chapter, section, problem.
00542 
00543 If multiple text-specific keys are given, then all must match for a single
00544 textbook.
00545 
00546 $action is called as follows:
00547 
00548     $action->($path, $tags, $text_index)
00549 
00550 There $path the path to the matching file, $tags a reference to the tag hash for
00551 the matching file, and $text_index the index into the @{$tags->{textbooks}} array
00552 if $pattern included textbook-specific tags.
00553 
00554 =cut
00555 
00556 sub gen_find_tags {
00557     my ($pattern, $action, $extra_editing_info) = @_;
00558     return sub {
00559         return unless /\.pg$/ and -f $File::Find::name;
00560         
00561         my $name = $File::Find::name;
00562         #my $relpath = $name;
00563         #$relpath =~ s/^$src\///;
00564         
00565         my %tags;
00566         
00567         open my $fh, "<", $name or do {
00568             warn "skipping $name: $!\n";
00569             return;
00570         };
00571         read_tags($fh, \%tags, $extra_editing_info);
00572         close $fh;
00573         
00574         my (%global_pattern, %textbook_pattern);
00575         foreach my $field (@global_fields) {
00576             $global_pattern{$field} = $pattern->{$field} if exists $pattern->{$field};
00577         }
00578         foreach my $field (@textbook_fields) {
00579             $textbook_pattern{$field} = $pattern->{$field} if exists $pattern->{$field};
00580         }
00581         
00582         if (%global_pattern) {
00583             return unless match_global(\%tags, \%global_pattern);
00584         }
00585         my $text_index;
00586         if (%textbook_pattern) {
00587             $text_index = match_textbook(\%tags, \%textbook_pattern);
00588             return unless $text_index >= 0;
00589         }
00590         
00591         $action->($name, \%tags, $text_index);
00592     };
00593 }
00594 
00595 sub match_global {
00596     my ($tags, $matches) = @_;
00597     foreach my $field (keys %$matches) {
00598         return 0 unless $tags->{$field} eq $matches->{$field};
00599     }
00600     return 1;
00601 }
00602 
00603 sub match_textbook {
00604     my ($tags, $matches) = @_;
00605     return -1 unless defined $tags->{textbooks};
00606     my @textbooks = @{$tags->{textbooks}};
00607     
00608     #textbook: foreach my $textbook (@{$tags->{textbooks}}) {
00609     textbook: foreach my $i (0 .. $#{$tags->{textbooks}}) {
00610         my $textbook = $tags->{textbooks}[$i];
00611         foreach my $field (keys %$matches) {
00612             next if $field !~ /^(title|edition|author|chapter|section|problem)$/;
00613             next textbook unless $textbook->{$field} eq $matches->{$field};
00614         }
00615         #warn "matched text i=$i: ", Dumper($textbook);
00616         return $i;
00617     }
00618     return -1;
00619 }
